channel.title: Comments for Mashable

item.title: Comment on The Earliest Photos of Apple’s iPad Hit the Web by Fido
item.dc:creator: Fido
item.description:
Amazing! Apple released the first i Pad in April 2010, selling 300,000 units on the first day and selling 3 million in 80 days. Record Sell !!!!!!!!!!
<a href="www.example.com/" / rel="nofollow">
item.content:encoded: Amazing! Apple released the first i Pad in April 2010, selling 300,000 units on the first day and selling 3 million in 80 days. Record Sell !!!!!!!!!!

item.title: Comment on Google Announces Plans to Fight Illicit Trading Networks by GrowMap
item.dc:creator: GrowMap
item.description:
Google IS Big Brother and this is how it starts. They'll claim it is only the "bad guys" they're after and then more and more groups will be "bad" until there is no one left to object.
First they came for the Socialists, and I did not speak out--
Because I was not a Socialist.
Then they came for the Trade Unionists, and I did not speak out--
Because I was not a Trade Unionist.
Then they came for the Jews, and I did not speak out--
Because I was not a Jew.
Then they came for me--and there was no one left to speak for me.
~ Martin Niemöller (1892-1984) ~
item.content:encoded:
Google IS Big Brother and this is how it starts. They’ll claim it is only the “bad guys” they’re after and then more and more groups will be “bad” until there is no one left to object.

First they came for the Socialists, and I did not speak out–
Because I was not a Socialist.
Then they came for the Trade Unionists, and I did not speak out–
Because I was not a Trade Unionist.
Then they came for the Jews, and I did not speak out–
Because I was not a Jew.
Then they came for me–and there was no one left to speak for me.
~ Martin Niemöller (1892-1984) ~

item.title: Comment on 10 Skills People Want to Learn From YouTube by PhoenixRichard
item.dc:creator: PhoenixRichard
item.description:
Like the how to survive 2012 - good luck on that. Also, person falls asleep watching how to fall asleep faster.
Mine was how to "dress" guitar frets. Found like 12. Taught me one thing. I coughed up the $50 to have a pro do it.
item.content:encoded:
Like the how to survive 2012 – good luck on that. Also, person falls asleep watching how to fall asleep faster.

Mine was how to “dress” guitar frets. Found like 12. Taught me one thing. I coughed up the $50 to have a pro do it.

item.title: Comment on YOLO in the Dictionary? Collins Crowdsources Lexicon by Shady Ballut
item.dc:creator: Shady Ballut
item.description: 17th and 18th centuries would think that, But for them to add Yolo in the dictionary is not smart, Just because a bunch of people are say Yolo doesn't mean it needs to be add in the dictionary. Yolo is lyrics from a popular hip-hop song. So does that mean any new words people are saying or making up we have to add it in the dictionary?
item.content:encoded: 17th and 18th centuries would think that, But for them to add Yolo in the dictionary is not smart, Just because a bunch of people are say Yolo doesn’t mean it needs to be add in the dictionary. Yolo is lyrics from a popular hip-hop song. So does that mean any new words people are saying or making up we have to add it in the dictionary?

item.title: Comment on Twist iPhone App Texts Friends When You’re Running Late by Shady Ballut
item.dc:creator: Shady Ballut
item.description: I just tried out the Twist app and it worked great, I guess you can't lie to people anymore about how far you are, but being late for me is a never. When you arrive to your destination it alert the person that you have arrive, I think that really great to use.
item.content:encoded: I just tried out the Twist app and it worked great, I guess you can’t lie to people anymore about how far you are, but being late for me is a never. When you arrive to your destination it alert the person that you have arrive, I think that really great to use.

item.title: Comment on Challenge Accepted: 15 Trivia Questions You’ll Probably Get Wrong by l_chambers
item.dc:creator: l_chambers
item.description:
Your answer to question #5 is incorrect. Brett Helquist was the illustrator of "A Series of Unfortunate Events," NOT the author. See http://www.bretthelquist.com for his portfolio of work.
Lemony Snicket is the pen name of Daniel Handler, who has also written several books for adults. http://www.lemony-snicket-stuff.com/daniel_handler_biography.html
item.content:encoded:
Your answer to question #5 is incorrect. Brett Helquist was the illustrator of “A Series of Unfortunate Events,” NOT the author. See http://www.bretthelquist.com for his portfolio of work.
Lemony Snicket is the pen name of Daniel Handler, who has also written several books for adults. http://www.lemony-snicket-stuff.com/daniel_handler_biography.html

item.title: Comment on OUYA CEO: We’re Confident We Will Deliver by my_ouya
item.dc:creator: my_ouya
item.description:
Confidence is one thing, delivering is another. So far we just don't know enough to say if Julie's just giving us the marketing spin or if this project is really on the way to change the console industry.
Cheers | Skyrant @ www.my-ouya.net | The biggest Ouya community on the Internet
item.content:encoded:
Confidence is one thing, delivering is another. So far we just don’t know enough to say if Julie’s just giving us the marketing spin or if this project is really on the way to change the console industry.

Cheers | Skyrant @ http://www.my-ouya.net | The biggest Ouya community on the Internet

item.title: Comment on Screen Time: How Much is Too Much for Your Kids? by Radford Castro
item.dc:creator: Radford Castro
item.description: I have two kids. Although it seems more commonplace to see kids at parties toy around with Mom/Dad's iPhone or iPad, I'd hate to think that would be the future. Even when I was growing up with Gameboys and NES, my parents wanted me to socialize. I can say with certainty that my parents helped me indirectly in how I conduct conversations with important business people that I wouldn't otherwise approach.
item.content:encoded: I have two kids. Although it seems more commonplace to see kids at parties toy around with Mom/Dad’s iPhone or iPad, I’d hate to think that would be the future. Even when I was growing up with Gameboys and NES, my parents wanted me to socialize. I can say with certainty that my parents helped me indirectly in how I conduct conversations with important business people that I wouldn’t otherwise approach.
